title: CAPSTONE Forges New Path for NASA’s Future Artemis Moon Missions
summary: NASA's CAPSTONE spacecraft has completed final maneuvers to place it in its target orbit around the Moon, refining its path in the orbit it arrived to last week.

title: NASA’s Orion spacecraft completes powered flyby of the moon
summary: NASA’s unpiloted Orion spacecraft fired its main engine for two-and-a-half minutes Monday just before the capsule soared 81 miles from the surface of the moon, completing a flyby maneuver to bend its trajectory toward a distant orbit for more testing ahead of future lunar missions with astronauts.

title: SpaceX to launch Eutelsat-10B on final flight of booster B1049
summary: SpaceX is set to launch the Eutelsat-10B communication satellite into a supersynchronous geostationary transfer orbit. A Falcon 9 Block 5 rocket carrying the satellite will lift off from Space Launch Complex 40 at the Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida with liftoff scheduled for Monday, Nov. 21 at 9:57 PM EST (02:57 UTC on Nov. 22). This will mark SpaceX’s 53rd mission of 2022 – keeping an average of a launch every 6.13 days.

title: Orion soars around the Moon with a lonely Earth in the distance
summary: The silvery spacecraft is on its way to an elongated orbit around the Moon.

title: Canadian startup developing lunar rover to deliver power
summary: A Canadian startup is developing a rover it plans to launch to the moon in the next few years to provide power to other spacecraft on the lunar surface.

title: NASA to Share Orion Update Today After Spacecraft Flies by Moon
summary: NASA will host a news conference at 5 p.m. EST today, Monday, Nov. 21, from the agency’s Johnson Space Center in Houston to discuss Orion’s lunar flyby as part of the Artemis I mission.

title: New Space Force procurement shop subscribes to the space-as-a-service model
summary: The Space Force is bucking traditional military procurement programs with a shop built to buy technologies that the space industry provides as a service.

title: NASA confirms decision to keep JWST name after historical report
summary: NASA says a historical review of actions by former administrator James Webb confirmed its decision to keep the agency’s flagship space telescope named after him.

title: Artemis 1 launch boosts ESA’s exploration ambitions
summary: The successful launch of the Artemis 1 mission comes just in time for the European Space Agency as it seeks support from its member states for new exploration initiatives.

title: Space Force opens door to Blue Origin with new cooperative agreement
summary: The U.S. Space Systems Command signed an agreement with Blue Origin that “paves the way” for the company’s New Glenn rocket to compete for national security launch contracts
